title: Risc Game
details: • Built a desktop strategy board game, including user-friendly GUI, a powerful server supporting multiple games, in-game chatting room, etc. It allows 2-4 players to move, attack, upgrade their units and forms alliance between each other
• Applied S.O.L.I.D design principles and many design patterns using Java, and also practiced with Java asynchronous features like Runnable, LinkedBlockingQueue, etc

• Nurtured a comprehensive skill set on software teamwork (Tasks breakdown, Solving conflicts, Git) and evolutionary software development(CI/CD pipeline, Docker, Automated regression test, Writing code that adaptable to change)

title: Duke Calendar Mobile App
description: A mobile app to inform Duke students with campus events
details: • Built an iOS mobile app to inform Duke students with campus events of various kinds, and it allows students to share their thoughts through comments
• Designed and implemented a user-friendly interface with new iOS 17 SwiftUI features, such as scroll view carousel effects and animations
• Implemented a back-end server using Vapor, which periodically pulls newest events data from school database, and supports RESTful API endpoints for updating the user with events and comments

title: Caching HTTP Proxy Server
description: A HTTP Proxy Server following RFC7234 specification
details: • Designed and implemented a Proxy Server that functions with GET, POST and CONNECT following the rules of RFC7234 specification
• Used C++11 to implement RAII technique for memory and resource management and achieved strong exception safety guarantee
• Designed a LRU cache to store HTTP responses for reduced latency and optimized resource usage

title: Mini-UPS website
description: Model real world package delivery services
details: • Built an UPS-like website that interacts with Mini-Amazon website and ”world” server using self-designed protocols to model real world package delivery services
• Using protocols containing sequence numbers and ACKs for retransmission (model TCP protocol)
• Implemented atomic Postgres queries in the back-end server and using Django framework to build the front-end website

title: LEFT Files Sharing
description: Large Efficient Flexible and Trusty file synchronization App
details: • Designed a file sharing application, which enabled large file synchronization between multiple hosts with partially updating, encryption, compression, error recovery, and resumption from interruption
• Gained solid experience about p2p architecture, multithreading design and socket programming

title: Semi-automatic Annotation Tool
details: • Developed an application for multi-camera dataset labeling which largely increased the efficiency and accuracy compared to manual labeling
• Applied R-CNN to detect the masks and bounding boxes of pedestrians. Improved convenience and accuracy for crowded pedestrian scenarios
• Used Python PyQt framework to build the desktop GUI with a user-friendly interface

title: This Website
details: • Used React props and hooks to create different components and manage component states
• Applied CSS modules to adjust website styles
• Use i18next to support website in both English and Chinese
